|website = [http://lima.osu.edu/ lima.osu.edu] }} '''The Ohio State University, Lima''', also referred to as '''Ohio State Lima''' is a regional campus of the [[Ohio State University|The Ohio State University]] located in [[Lima, Ohio|Lima]], [[Ohio]]. Its {{convert|565|acre|km2|sing=on}} campus is located in Lima, {{convert|80|mi|km}} south of [[Toledo, Ohio]]. It offers over 140 courses and 10 [[bachelor degree]] programs in [[science]] and [[liberal Arts]]. Eight of ten programs are four-year programs at Lima. Two of them are baccalaureate completion programs. In addition to regional accreditation, Ohio State Lima has baccalaureate program accreditation with NCATE. Students can start at Lima and finish their degrees at The Ohio State University, Columbus with one of Ohio Stateâs 170+ [[Academic major|majors]]. The Ohio State University at Lima offers over 20 student clubs and organizations and 10 intramural and club athletic teams. {{Citation needed|date=January 2010}} The Lima Campus Library has approximately 80,000 books, microform items, CDs, and videos, and online access to nearly 400 subscription databases. {{Citation needed|date=January 2010}} The University shares the campus with [[James A. Rhodes State College]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ohiohistorycentral.org/entry.php?rec=2522|title=James A. Rhodes State College|date=2006-07-12|publisher=Ohio History Central|accessdate=2008-11-08}} == Academic programs == 8 Complete four year programs are: *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/business.php Business] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/biology.php Biology] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/education.php Education] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/english.php English] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/financial_management.php Family Financial Management] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/history.php History] *[http://www-afa.adm.ohio-state.edu/u-majors/pdf/healthsci.pdf Health Sciences/ Health Management] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/psychology.php Psychology] 2 Baccalaureate completion programs are: *[http://www.lima.ohio-state.edu/admissions/dental_hyg.php Dental Hygiene] *[http://lima.osu.edu/admissions/nursing.php Nursing (RN to BSN)] 4 Graduate programs are: *[http://lima.osu.edu/academics/education/educmasters.html Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Early Childhood or Middle Childhood Education] *[http://lima.osu.edu/academics/education/educMA.html Master of Arts in Education] *[http://lima.osu.edu/academics/wde/ Master of Arts in Workforce Development and Education] *[http://lima.osu.edu/academics/msw/index.html Master of Social Work] == Student life == === Student organizations === The Ohio State University at Lima offers students opportunities for social, recreational, cultural, and educational growth. These organizations include {{cite web|url=http://lima.osu.edu/students/studentclubs.php |title=Student Life: Student Organizations and Clubs |accessdate=2009-12-31 |publisher=The Ohio State University at Lima }}: *Campus Crusade for Christ *Biology Club *Buckeye Scholars *Challengers Club *Psychology Club *M.A.R.S. (RPGaming Club) *The OSU Lima Student Senate *The Worthington Society (Creative Writing Club) *History Club *College Democrats *College Republicans *Newman Catholic Association *ACEI. *Math Club. *Business Club *Lima Campus Music Club. The Ohio State University at Lima is the only regional campus of The Ohio State University to have a pep band. It was started Winter Quarter, 2009, and has since played for the President of The Ohio State University, E. Gordon Gee, as well as multiple award banquets. === Sport clubs and intramural sports === The Lima Campus has five different club sports to choose from: *Men's Basketball, *Men's Baseball, *Men's Golf, *Women's Basketball, *Women's Volleyball The mascot is the Barons and OSU Lima athletics are members of the [[Ohio Regional Campus Conference]] (O.R.C.C.).
